properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
Locally strong and gusty winds will persist through Friday
morning along the eastern slopes of the Prairie Coteau in
northeast South Dakota. Southwesterly winds of 25 to 40 mph with
occasional gusts over 50 mph are expected. The locations most
affected would be the higher terrain areas of the Prairie Coteau
as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills. This would include
Interstate 29 between Summit and Peever, or between mile markers
210 and 225. U.S. Highway 12 from Summit to Milbank may also
experience strong winds. The strong winds will create areas of
blowing and drifting snow, with reduced visibility and icy road
conditions possible. Anyone with travel plans across far
northeast South Dakota this afternoon through Friday morning
should be prepared for inclement weather and are urged to slow
down and allow for extra distance between vehicles if need be.

NWSheadline: AREAS OF BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW, ALONG WITH SLICK ROADWAYS
